org.openlaszlo.lzproject.rest
Class TaskRestController

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          org.openlaszlo.lzproject.rest.BaseRestController
              org.openlaszlo.lzproject.rest.TaskRestController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class TaskRestController
extends BaseRestController

Rest controller for all REST web service calls around tasks in LZTRack, using /lzproject/rest/task/* for the servlet mapping.

Author:
raju

Method Detail

doGet

public void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
           throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                  java.io.IOException
Handle a HTTP GET request to the task REST service.

LZProject sends all the data through HTTP posts as it is the only safe way to send unicode to the server; the forwarding of the request to doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse) is only done to make testing of the web service easier. Loot at doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse) for the processing of the REST request.

Overrides:
doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Parameters:
request - an HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client has made of the servlet
response - an HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an input or output error is detected when the servlet handles the GET request
javax.servlet.ServletException - if the request for the GET could not be handled

doPost

public void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
            throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                   java.io.IOException
Handle a HTTP POST request to the task REST service.

LZProject sends all the data through HTTP posts as it is the only safe way to send unicode to the server.

doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Parameters:
